sections.text: Brown’s Biostatistics ScM trains students in statistical methods for biomedical and public health applications, with a focus on methodological innovation and applied data analysis.

items: Core courses in probability, inference, and regression
Electives in statistical computing and survival analysis
sections.text: Students complete rigorous coursework in theoretical and applied statistics, culminating in applied research or thesis work.

items: Bachelor’s degree with strong background in math and probability
Third semester calculus, linear algebra, probability
At least one year professional experience for online option
TOEFL ≥100 iBT or IELTS ≥7.0 for international applicants
sections.text: Applicants are expected to have advanced mathematics preparation, recommendations, and clear motivation for biostatistical training.
Graduates work in health analytics, pharmaceuticals, public health agencies, or pursue doctoral training.
